means: [人名] [北方英格兰人姓氏] 塔恩地貌名称，小湖或池，来源于北方中世纪英语

word_mean: 冰斗湖一种山间的小的湖泊

sentence.Network_en: The deep and dark tarn at my feet closed over the fragments of the House of Usher.
sentence.Network_cn: 我脚下深邃阴沉的小湖将厄谢尔古屋的断垣残墙吞没了.

sentence.Network_en: This pool or tarn was encircled by tree!
sentence.Network_cn: 这个池塘,或是说山潭吧,四周全被树木围了起来.

sentence.Network_en: The goods are to be tarn ( s ) shipped at Honk.

list.abs: 米约大桥建在塔恩河谷（Tarn Valley）上方1125英尺的高空。当我们穿越在这座桥上时就像飞翔一样，因为云朵环绕在我们的周围。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally northern English dialect): from Old Norse tjǫrn

entry.def: A tarn is a small lake in an area of mountains.

means.word_mean: 1. a mountain lake (especially one formed by glaciers)
